ipl::CPixelGroup Class Reference

CPixelGroup, contains a group of pixels, it can optionally contain color information for each position, last updated 1/25/2002. More...

    Runs through all positions in the group and update the left/right/top/bottom boundaries, this is usefull if you have used the fast methods which do not update boundary values.

Fast functions, no updating of boundaries!
  • bool RemovePositionFast (unsigned int Index)
    Same as RemovePosition, except that there is no range check for given index and the boundary is not updated and hence the function is a lot faster.

  • void AddPositionFast (INT16 x, INT16 y)
    Same as AddPosition, except the boundary is not updated.

  • void AddPositionFast (const CPoint2D< INT16 > &Pos)
    Same as AddPositionFast, except the position is given in a CPoint2D<INT16> type.

  • bool InsertPositionFast (INT16 x, INT16 y, unsigned int Index)
    Same as InsertPosition, except that there is no range check for given index and if colors are available it is ignored, the function simply inserts the position without referencing the color.

    Same as InsertPositionFast, except the position is given in a CPoint2D<INT16> type.

Detailed Description

CPixelGroup, contains a group of pixels, it can optionally contain color information for each position, last updated 1/25/2002.

One example of use is segmentation algorithms. The simple blob-algorithm found in the CSegmentate class uses several CPixelGroup objects to store the found segments in. The class CPixelGroups is used to keep track of many CPixelGroup objects. A template based group holding positions is also available, see CPositionGroup2D for more information.

This class has two iterators: ConstIterator and Iterator. They work like the iterators in the C++ std-library, so if you are familiar with them, these are very easy to use. Here is an example: 

        CPixelGroup Grp;
        // Fill some pixels in the Grp object...

        // Search whole group for given positions
        // this could be done by calling PosInGroup(), but to demonstrate
        // the iterator class, we will do it this way
        CPoint2D<INT16> P(1500,388); // just a random position
        CPixelGroup::ConstIterator It;
        // iterating whole group with the ConstIterator class
        for(It=Grp.Begin();It<Grp.End();It++)
        {
                // The internal representation of positions in a CPixelGroup is
                // stored in a C struct T2DInt, but functions are available for
                // comparing CPoint2D<INT16> with these T2DInt, so no time consuming
                // conversion is needed. It means that the comparison 
                // '((P.GetX()==It->x) && (P.GetY()==It->y))' is not faster than 
                // 'P==*t', even though the last comparison is two different types.
                if (P==*It)
                {
                        cout << "Found P" << endl;
                        // If you explicitly need to convert the iterator
                        // value to a CPoint2D<INT16>, the method ToCPoint2D() can do it
                        cout << It.ToCPoint2D() << endl;
                }

        }
        // Doing the same without the iterator is considerably slower.
        // On a PENTIUM III with Visual C++ 6.0 it is about a factor 4 slower.
        for(int i=0; i<Grp.GetTotalPositions(); i++)
        {
                if (P==Grp.GetPosition(i))
                        cout << "Found P" << endl;
        }

For more details, see CPixelGroupIterator and CPixelGroupConstIterator classes.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

See also:
CPixelGroups , CPositionGroup2D , CPositionGroupIterator , CPositionGroupConstIterator
Version:
1.60, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ipl::CPixelGroup::CPixelGroup (  unsigned int    InitialSize,
bool    AllocateColors = false
) 
 

Constructor allocating memory for pixel positions to be contained in this class.

To make insertions fast, call this funcion with a value in InitialSize greater than the expected pixels in the group.

Parameters:
InitialSize  Number of positions to allocate memory for.
AllocateColors  If true, a color array is also allocated, defaults to false. Must be 1 or greater.

Definition at line 53 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::AddColors (  const CStdImage &    Img ) 
 

Get the original pixel colors from the inserted pixels and given source image and insert them into the PixelGroup.

Note: If you later on call AddPosition() or InsertPosition() without adding a color, memory for previous allocated colors are deleted since the number of allocated colors does not equal number of positions. The class takes care of it.

Parameters:
pSource  Image to get the original pixel values from. The PixelGroups positions must be derived from this image.
Returns :
False if the PixelGroup has no pixels in it, colors have already been added or one of the parameters is a NULL pointer.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::AddPosition (  INT16    x,
INT16    y
)  [inline]
 

The position (x,y) is added to the group of pixels.

If pixel colors are present this function cannot be used. A call to RemoveColors() is then needed. The method AddColorsToGroup() can be called later to insert the colors again if a source image is available. The boundary is updated if the new position is outside the old boundary.

Parameters:
x  Position in horisontal direction.
y  Position in vertical direction.
Returns :
False, if colors are available, in that case the method does nothing.
See also:
AddPositionFast

void ipl::CPixelGroup::AddPositionFast (  INT16    x,
INT16    y
)  [inline]
 

Same as AddPosition, except the boundary is not updated.

It is not checked if the colors are available, i.e. it is not legal later on to access the colors eventhough they seem to be available! You can manually later on call RemoveColors() and AllocColors() to update the array, but earlier values will be lost.

Parameters:
x  Position in horisontal direction.
y  Position in vertical direction.
See also:
AddPosition

Definition at line 608 of file pixelgroup.h.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::AddToImage (  CStdImage &    Dest ) 
 

Adds the points in PixelGroup to the already allocated image, only the positions contained in the pixelgroup will affect the image.

Positions outside image are ignored. The color values in the pixelgroup are used when inserting postitions, if you want the positions plotted with a constant color call the method AddToImage(CStdImage& Dest, UINT32 Color). Ensure that the bit depth (and palette if present) complies with the color values in the pixelgroup. The method will not do any tests for that. The function automaically does the copying as fast as possible by doing some range checks before entering the inner loops.

Parameters:
Dest  Image to plot points in, only pixels at positions contained in pixelgroup will affect the image.
Returns :
False, if pPixelgroup is NULL.
See also:
True, always when using this C++ version of the algorithm.

Definition at line 300 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

References ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr().

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::AddToImage (  CStdImage &    Dest,
UINT32    Color
) 
 

Adds the points in PixelGroup to the already allocated image, only the positions contained in the pixelgroup will affect the image.

Positions outside image are ignored. If the pixelgroup contains color values they can be used as plotting values by calling the method AddColorsToImage(CStdImage& Dest) instead. The method automaically does the copying as fast as possible by doing some range checks before entering the inner loops.

Parameters:
Dest  Image to plot points in, only pixels at positions contained in pixelgroup will affect the image.
Color  A UINT32 value containing the color, in case of a palette it is the index in the palette. If the group contains colors, you can use them by calling AddToImage(CStdImage& Dest) instead of this function.
Returns :
True, always when using this C++ version of the algorithm.

Definition at line 288 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

References ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr().

void ipl::CPixelGroup::AdjustSizeOfPositions (    ) 
 

Removes unused memory allocated for pixel positions in this class.

If colors are available the color array will also be adjusted. Because memory allocation is a time consuming operation it is a good idea by each ReAllocPositions (or the CPixelGroup(unsigned int InitialSize) constructor) call to allocate a big number of pixels and then at the end of the construction of a CPixelGroup calling this AdjustSizeOfPositions() method to deallocate unused memory.

Definition at line 225 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::AllocAndInitColors (  UINT32    InitialValue ) 
 

Same as AllocColors but here the initial value of the allocated cells can be specified.

Note: If you later on call AddPosition() or InsertPosition() without adding a color, memory for previous allocated colors are deleted since the number of allocated colors does not equal number of positions. The class takes care of it.

Parameters:
InitialValue  Initial value of allocated colors.
Returns :
False, if colors are allready available.
See also:
AllocColors

Definition at line 242 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::AllocColors (    ) 
 

Allocates cells for color values but does not initialize the values.

Faster than using AllocAndInitColors(). Note: If you later on call AddPosition() or InsertPosition() without adding a color, memory for previous allocated colors are deleted since the number of allocated colors does not equal number of positions. The class takes care of it.

Returns :
False, if colors are allready available.
See also:
AllocAndInitColors

Definition at line 119 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

References TPixelGroup::pColor.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::CopyToImage (  const CPalette *    pPalette,
UINT32    BackGround,
CStdImage &    Dest
) 
 

Copies a pixel group to a new image.

Origo of the new image is set to (-Left.x,-Top.y) which is the pixelgroups top left boundary. There are three cases which decides the bit depth of the output image: 1) No colors available (i.e. the method AddColors() has not been called), then a black and white image with 1 b/p is produced and the positions are plotted in the image according to the "Color" member of the TPixelGroup-structure. If the Color-type is undefined the default is a white background with black pixels set at the given positions. 2) Colors available but no palette is given (i.e. Palette is a NULL pointer), then an image with a graytone palette is produced if the Bits pixel depth member of CPixelGroup is 1 or 8. If the pixel depts is 24 b/p an image with 24 b/p without a palette is produced. 3) Colors available and a palette is provided. An image with pixel depth given in CPixelGroup and the given palette is produced. The pallette must correspond with the pixel depth in the TPixelGroup, otherwise an error message will be produced.

Parameters:
pPalette  The pallette to be used in the new image. If no colors are available or the pixel depth is 24 b/p this parameter is ignored. If the parameter is NULL a default palette is used (see case 2 above).
BackGround  The background color of new image, the user must be sure that the value in case of 1 or 8 b/p is in the range of the palette index and in case of 24 b/p the value must be the RGB color.
Dest  Image to copy the group to. All previous information in Dest is destroyed.
Returns :
False, if the pixel group is empty.

UINT32 ipl::CPixelGroup::GetColor (  unsigned int    Index )  const [inline]
 

Returns the color corresponding to the position stored at "Index" in the group.

Maximum index is GetTotalPostitions()-1. There may not be any colors stored in the group, use ColorsAvailable() to check this. For faster access consider using the operator[].

Returns :
Position at given index, returns 0 if index is out of range or if colors are unavailable.
See also:
operator[]

Definition at line 522 of file pixelgroup.h.

References TPixelGroup::NumberOfPixels, and TPixelGroup::pColor.

COLORTYPE ipl::CPixelGroup::GetColorType (    )  const
 

Returns the color type, HIGHCOLOR if the group is derived from high color pixels otherwise the value is LOWCOLOR.

This value may not be used by all segmentation algorithms.

Returns :
The color type from which the positions were derived.

const TPixelGroup * ipl::CPixelGroup::GetConstTPixelGroupPtr (    )  const

In other cases do not use this function to manipulate the pixel group but use the methods in this class!

Returns :
pointer to pixel group data

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::InsertPosition (  INT16    x,
INT16    y,
unsigned int    Index
) 
 

Inserts the position (x,y) at given Index, which must be less than the inserted pixels (returned by GetTotalPositions()).

The ordering of the positions is preserved. If pixel colors are present this function cannot be used. A call to RemoveColors() is then needed. The method AddColorsToGroup() can be called later to insert the colors again if a source image is available. The boundary is updated if the new position is outside the old boundary.

Parameters:
x  Position in horisontal direction.
y  Position in vertical direction.
Index  Index in the array of positions to be removed.
Returns :
False, if pixel colors are present or if Index is out of range.
See also:
InsertPositionFast

Definition at line 143 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

unsigned int    Index
)

Returns :
False, if colors are not available, in that case the method does nothing.
See also:
AddPositionColorFast

Definition at line 628 of file pixelgroup.h.

CPixelGroup & ipl::CPixelGroup::operator= (  const CPixelGroup &    SourceGroup ) 
 

overloading of assignment operator, deletes old pixel positions in destination.

Also deletes the color values if available. Calls the kernel function k_CopyGroup().

Definition at line 62 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

References GetConstTPixelGroupPtr(), and GetTPixelGroupPtr().

T2DInt ipl::CPixelGroup::operator[] (  unsigned int    Index )  [inline]
 

overloading of []-operator.

Returns the position at Index, no range check, fast access. Note, this operator returns a T2DInt kernel C structure to avoid allocation of a CPoint2D<INT16> as in GetPosition() and hence make the access faster. The T2DInt structure contains attributes x and y of type INT16.

See also:
GetPosition

)

Returns :
true if the position was found, false if not found.

Prints the information contained in the PixelGroup to stdout.

Definition at line 346 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

void ipl::CPixelGroup::ReAllocPositions (  unsigned int    NewSize ) 
 

Reallocates memory for the positions contained in this class.

If colors are available the color array will also be adjusted. The new allocated memory is not initialised.

Parameters:
NewSize  The new number of positions to allocate memory for. Note: The NewSize may be less than the actual allocated memory! In that case the corresponding positions stored in the end of the actual memory are deleted.

Definition at line 220 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

void ipl::CPixelGroup::RemoveColors (    ) 
 

Removes colors stored in the m_pGroup member attribute.

If no colors are present, the method just returns without doing anything.

Definition at line 266 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

unsigned int ipl::CPixelGroup::RemoveDuplicates (    ) 
 

Removes duplicates of same position in this pixelgroup.

The algorithm could probably be more efficient but it is still nice to have this functionality. To make it a bit efficient though, the order of the positions is not preserved, i.e. the same code as RemovePosition is used to remove positions, but no update of boundary is neccesary.

Returns :
Total number of duplicate positions removed.

Definition at line 215 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::RemovePosition (  unsigned int    Index ) 
 

Removes a position stored in the group at given index.

Done by moving the last position in the pPos array contained in the m_pGroup (type TPixelGroup) to the index which is to be removed. If pixel colors are available, the color array is updated. The boundary is also updated if the removed position causes changes in the boundary.

Parameters:
Index  Index in the array of position to be removed.
Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.
See also:
RemovePositionSlow

Definition at line 191 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::RemovePositionFast (  unsigned int    Index )  [inline]
 

Same as RemovePosition, except that there is no range check for given index and the boundary is not updated and hence the function is a lot faster.

Returns :
True, always.
See also:
RemovePosition

Definition at line 603 of file pixelgroup.h.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::RemovePositionSlow (  unsigned int    Index ) 
 

Same as RemovePosition, but the ordering of the pixels is preserved.

This method is slower than RemovePosition.

Parameters:
Index  Index in the array of position to be removed.
Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.
See also:
RemovePosition

Definition at line 203 of file pixelgroup.cpp.

bool ipl::CPixelGroup::SetColor (  UINT32    ColorValue,
unsigned int    Index
)  [inline]
 

Sets the color ColorValue corresponding to the position stored at "Index" in the group.

Maximum index is GetTotalPostitions()-1. There may not be any colors stored in the group, use ColorsAvailable() to check this.

Returns :
False, if index is out of range or if colors are unavailable.
